ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: History of Bilateral Chronic Otitis Media and Cholesteatoma
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Lifelong history of ear infections, cholesteatoma, and multiple otosurgeries bilaterally.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Conductive Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Significant air-bone gaps present bilaterally with normal bone conduction thresholds.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Tympanic Membrane Perforation (Left)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Documented long-standing large left-sided tympanic membrane perforation.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Status Post-Mastoidectomy (Right)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of revision canal wall down mastoidectomy with ossicular chain reconstruction in the right ear.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess the degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss given the surgical history.
To evaluate speech reception thresholds and word recognition ability.
Standard assessment for middle ear function, though contraindicated in this specific instance due to surgical history and perforation.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Testing revealed a bilateral conductive pathology, significantly asymmetrical with the right ear being worse. The right ear showed a moderately severe to mild conductive hearing loss sloping to moderate/moderately severe at high frequencies. The left ear showed a mild conductive hearing loss rising to slight mixed loss and sloping to mild conductive at high frequencies. Cochlear function was normal bilaterally. Speech recognition was excellent in both ears. Immittance was not measured due to the surgical history and perforation.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right Ear: Moderately severe to mild conductive loss (250-4000 Hz), sloping to moderate/moderately severe at high frequencies; PTA 55 dB HL. Left Ear: Mild conductive loss rising to slight mixed loss (500-2000 Hz), sloping to mild conductive at high frequencies; PTA 30 dB HL. Normal bone conduction (0-10 dB HL).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right Ear: SRT 55 dB HL, WRS 92% at 90 dB HL. Left Ear: SRT 25 dB HL, WRS 94% at 70 dB HL. Results in agreement with PTA.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Not measured due to significant surgical history (Right) and large tympanic membrane perforation (Left).

proposed_items: Annual hearing tests to monitor stability
Evaluation for amplification and Hearing Assistive Technology (HAT)
Custom hearing protection for high noise environments
counseling_actions: Explain that nerve function is intact despite conductive loss
Review reasons for not performing tympanometry (surgical history/perforation)

escalation.rationale_short: Continue scheduled follow-up for management of chronic otitis media and post-surgical status.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor stability of hearing and evaluate needs for amplification and HAT.

expected_outcome: Patient followed up with an otologist as scheduled.
Audiological recommendations included annual hearing tests to monitor stability.
Recommendations included evaluation for amplification and HAT, and use of hearing protection in noise.
